Invented by French engineer Renaud Kerbrat, the Vector uses an unconventional delayed blowback system to reduce recoil and muzzle climb by transferring energy downward rather than rearward. It is the ideal choice for law enforcement and military units seeking a controllable, compact weapon system for close quarter combat environments.
